Reviews.Title: Great camera for quick snaps
Reviews.Author: D. M. Kemp
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera now for a few weeks and have come to really like it.  It is so thin and lightweight that it can easily be carried in a pocket, purse, or backpack.  Compared to the size of today's smartphones, this is actually smaller than some.The pictures are decent.  I find some of the interior pictures are a bit grainy, even with the flash.  The flash is plenty bright - so no issues there.  Switching to low light mode made all the difference.  This quick change off the menu function made for clear crisp pictures.Outdoor pictures are really outstanding.  Super clear and crisp.  Sometimes it has problems figuring out what to focus on.  However, when a face appears, it is really pretty good at identifying it and focusing on it.One of my favorite features is the rechargable lithium ion battery.  I hate having to deal with batteries.  However, it is a bit of an annoyance to get it charged as it requires the battery to be ejected from the camera and placed into a charger.The final reason why this inexpensive camera does not get a five star rating is the long time it takes between pictures.  Even on a fully charged battery, it takes on average 5 seconds for the camera to process each shot. If you are trying to take a bunch of group photos, this can seem like forever.Overall - I like this camera.  It is relatively inexpensive and takes great snapshots.

Reviews.Title: A2300 - a good choice for a BASIC point & shoot that anyone can use
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I received this camera last week (purchased for a 12 year old niece's birthday). This camera, even though it's listed as red, is actually bright pink, but it's still subtle, it doesn't SCREAM bright pink. One thing that surprised me is that it's made of metal, not plastic like others in the under $100 price range. However, it is made in China, but I own other cameras that are in the $400+ range that were also made in China, so price isn't the determining factor on the manufacturing location.The Canon A2500 is a newer version of this camera, but if you do a comparison between the new A2500 and this one, the A2300, the specs are nearly identical in features. The only difference I could find was a very slight difference in overall size and a small difference in photos per battery charge even though they use the same battery.I decided, before gifting it to her, that I would make sure it was operational. (ETA: I gave this Canon to my niece, she loves it; as for myself, I wouldn't be thrilled with it as I want a camera with more manually-selected features.)This is a BASIC point and shoot camera, almost as basic as you will find nowadays. Which makes this a good choice for a person that's new to digital, young, old, anyone really.It's a small camera, easily fits in a pocket. The buttons are laid-out well so you don't hit a wrong button when you meant to push another. In this regard, much better than a couple of the Canon Elph models I tried previously. Build quality itself seems very good, but I do notice some noise in the zoom motor when playing back videos.Leave it on SmartAuto. Your photos will be good 99% of the time. But if you think you will get DSLR-quality images with this camera? Heck, no! You can't expect that with a camera this price. This camera is not that great in low light if you don't use the flash; when there's not enough light your photos will be grainy. It takes *very good* photos outdoors on a sunny day---but almost any camera will give you the same. I'd even go so far to say that some Smartphones will take better photos than this camera.No matter where you're shooting make sure you can hold steady while shooting-sure, this has digital image stabilization, but it's not as good as optical stabilization. And as far as I can tell, the Digital IS is only active when you choose the "Digital IS" setting by choosing Program-FuncSet-and right clicking the control wheel to Digital IS. This is disappointing that it's not available on all settings.The menus are typical Canon, and there is no dial like the more expensive cameras have.No optical viewfinder for those of you wanting to know. The LCD screen is average quality, not enough "dots", so when you take a photo and look at it on the camera's screen, it doesn't look nearly as good as when you upload it to your computer. I think I'm spoiled by my Sony cameras that have 921,000 dots, compared to this Canon that has only 230,000 dots.It's a little slow between shots, there is "processing" lag, especially when using the flash.Videos are "ok" with this camera, 720p is fine for those with an older computer. If you want a camera that has GREAT video I would suggest one of the Sony HX models like the HX10V which I own Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX10V 18.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 16x Optical Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Black) (2012 Model), but you will pay a lot more for that camera - IMHO Sony cameras are hands-down the best at video. Back to this Canon: Yes, this Canon has audio with the video, but it's not stereo. You cannot optically zoom during the video, but you can do so before you first press the video button. If you DO use the zoom button after pushing the video button, it will be CRUMMY-looking digital zoom and you will hear noticeable zoom motor noise/clicking, at least on this camera I did.I wish it had FEWER megapixels than 16 MP. The sensor, being a 1/2.3 like most cheaper cameras, is too small. More megapixels are NOT better unless the sensor size is also larger to go along with it. This is part of the reason these cameras are crummy in low-light situations. Of course, you will pay a LOT more for a camera with a larger sensor, at least $300+. So this Canon will "do" - there's always some kind of sacrifice one makes when choosing a camera.One thing I really like about this is the use of a lithium ion battery as opposed to AA batteries, and it has a separate battery charger.  It also comes with Canon photo editing software, which I've used for years and I think is better than Picasa, although there are less editing features to choose.No internal memory at all, so make sure you buy an SDHC card if you don't already have one-otherwise you will be very disappointed when you go to use this camera the first time. I recommend a Class 10 card, especially if you plan on shooting videos.  Transcend 8 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card (TS8GSDHC10E)

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Point And Shoot
Reviews.Author: Shihtzu Mom
Reviews.Content: The Canon A2300 is a great point and shoot camera for casual users. It's easy to use, and takes very clear pictures with wonderful color rendition. It has reasonable resolution (clarity) in zoom mode, and performs well for action shots at sporting events. The auto mode settings are fine for most photos. Low light zoom shots (such as stage shows in dark auditoriums)may not be completely acceptable, but that's a tough condition for any camera and should NOT be considered a serious flaw. The movie mode works well, with good clarity and color. Bottom line: for everyday shapshots (condidering the performance, features, and price) you'll be happy with the A2300. For more details you can download the user manual from the Canon website.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: lulu
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty neat little camera.This is not a power house this is a small camera to carry for quick shots of your kids or even something light to travel with when you larger camera is packed up in your luggage.It has a few simple really useful functions, a modest zoom (though 5x out does some of the other cameras like this)the lens seems to be doing it's job. 16 mega pixels makes for a pretty clear photo. There is small shutter lag but a good sd card seems to help that and it's on par with other digital cameras of this kind.I really like this little camera and I look forward to using it.So far...CuteLightCompacteasy to usedecent photosA+ for this sort of camera.I will update at a later date after I use it a bit, maybe even post a sample photo or two.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera - Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: Troldilocks "Troldilocks"
Reviews.Content: I have owned the same Olympus camera for the past 12 years.  I refused to get rid of the big and bulky older model because it took such high quality pictures.  I didn't think any camera out there could top it but I was wrong.  This little camera packs a lot of bang for the buck.  My old camera didn't zoom in very closely but I can get great close ups with my new PowerShot.  I was looking for a less bulky smaller camera and I have to admit that when I pulled it out of the box my first reaction was that it's definitely smaller and I hope it takes good pics.  This camera is slightly larger than a deck of cards.  I took it to a festival and hoped and prayed that the pictures would take.  I downloaded them as soon as I got home.  The quality is superb!  It's even better than my old Olympus.  My husband was so impressed with my tiny camera that now he wants to get rid of his 10 year old model Cannon for one.  His words "I can't believe that little bitty camera took those great shots."  Pics are not grainy, dim or distorted and true to colors.  I carry it everywhere with me now in my purse which is something I would not do with my bulky older model.  I love the color of the camera too. I ordered the red but it actually looks more pink to me which is what I was hoping for any way.  You will not be disappointed with this camera.  I am a point-and-shoot picture taker who doesn't want to mess with shutters, settings or anything else and this camera is absolutely perfect for me.  I highly recommend it for other point-and-shooters as well.  The price just can't be beat.  I should also mention that it was a toss up between purchasing a Canon and a much more expensive Nikon Coolpix.  I chose the Canon after reading the reviews here and I'm glad I did.  I am extremely pleased with my purchase.  Worth mentioning:  It was packaged very well and arrived quickly.  I ordered it two days before the festival, next day service, hoping that I might I get it in time.  I did and was able to load the memory card, charge the battery (another feature I love - rechargeable battery) and read the operator's manual before the next morning.

Reviews.Title: This camera is inexpensive for a reason
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I have owned several canon cameras, including SLR, DSLR, and several point-and-shoots, and this one is by far the most disappointing. Looking at the specs, I couldn't figure out why this camera was only a third of the price of other recently released Canon point-and-shoots, so I decided to try it out. I got it just in time for a trip to the Grand Canyon and Sedona, AZ... and now that I'm looking through my photos, I wish I would have just stuck with my DSLR. The colors are very dull on auto mode. We were at Red Rock National Park, and the rocks look brown in my photos, not red like they actually were... I tried the vivid color setting, hoping it would help... but that setting added TOO much color. It made a cactus look neon green and the red rocks look bright orange. And if you use the vivid color setting to take a photo of a person, they will look like tan mom. (i.e. orange)Besides the colors being either very dull or unnaturally bright, the photos from this camera are just not very crisp. The sky is pixelated/noisy in almost every image, and the photos of us are just kind of flat and blurry looking. I wish I could blame this on a lack of knowledge about cameras, but I can't... I use a high-end DSLR in manual mode every day for my job. (NOTE: I am not comparing this camera to a high-end DSLR. I just want people to understand that the disappointing quality of photos from this camera are not due to operator's error.)For less than a hundred bucks, it isn't terrible... but I was just hoping it would be as good as my Canon Powershot SD1200IS, which only cost fifty dollars more (3 years ago) and took amazing photos.It is a cute camera though (although the entire body is plastic)... so if you don't want to spend more than a hundred bucks, I think it's an okay deal.EDIT: Wow, a lot of commenters seem to be under the impression that I am comparing this camera to a high-end DSLR. I am absolutely not comparing the two. The only cameras I compared this to were previous models of Canon point and shoots that I owned and loved. This camera was cheaper than those, and I knew that when I bought it. But never having owned a bad Canon product, I expected it to take better photos than it actually does. I only purchased this camera because my beloved SD1200IS was stolen at my wedding and I needed a cheap replacement that I can carry around in my purse. I do not own the expensive DSLR that I use at work, thus I cannot just take it with me when I go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: I was about to make a trip to China for five weeks and was worried about the camera I was already planning to take, a Nikon Coolpix, getting lost or stolen. So I went to the store to look at buying a back-up camera that wouldn't cost much just in case my Nikon failed me during the trip. This camera was on sale for only $99 and had a good rating on the store website, so I bought it on the spot thinking it would just be a nice replacement if needed.However when I took it home and was playing with it, I was amazed at how much better this camera works than my Nikon. It is a lot better at adjusting to different settings automatically, and most pictures come out almost professional quality even without focusing and setting up the shot. It works really well in low light settings which I definitely can't say for the Nikon and which is something I was going to look for the next time I seriously went shopping for a new digital camera. Now that "next time" will be a long way off because I'm so satisfied with this one.Like most cameras, this one will work best if you stop to choose the right setting and focus your picture properly, but in most environments even a quick point and shoot will deliver a good quality picture. I also love that I was able to get it in bright blue, and I've even dropped it on stone but it still works perfectly! Considering I only spent about 100 dollars on this camera, I'm extremely satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: good review
Reviews.Author: Silvia
Reviews.Content: Good product overall, but small and looks a bit fragile. When taking the picture it looks a bit grainy in the LCD, but one the picture is taken, it shows up clearer. Good for the money.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and does good pix
Reviews.Author: Frankly Thespian
Reviews.Content: Intuitive menus. Small. Battery keeps charge for a long time. Takes good photos. No problems after three months. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Goof proof
Reviews.Author: Iggie Lover
Reviews.Content: Love the color, small size, and simplicity of operation.  The BEST part is the rechargeable battery that lasts and lasts.  No more carrying around extra batteries.

Reviews.Title: Value for Money camera.
Reviews.Author: v.s.
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional camera user. but i am pleased with features with such a low price camera. good in low light. and very good photos in day light. happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A2300
Reviews.Author: Grex
Reviews.Content: This camera is just another in a long line of excellent point & shoots from Canon.  This one is a slip-in-your-pocket, fully automatic.  I am partial to Canon.  The best price I found on the Internet was at Amazon.  I especially like the 28mm Wide-angle lens.  With 16 MP it is as powerful as any P & S on the market.  With the 5 X Zoom this is an excellent camera for portraits and other subjects indoors or around the yard.  Mine came with a stylish red casing.  I bought it as a gift for my wife.  She was very pleased.  I have been an amateur photographer since the middle 1980s.  Canon is always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: It seems like a lot of the people making low reviews bought an inexpensive camera and expected the performance of an expensive camera.I think this camera performs great, for the price.I also own an expensive DSLR, but I wanted a very small point and shoot that I could just keep on me at all times. I couldn't pass up the low price tag for this one.I'm very satisfied with it. Before, I was relying on my phone for pictures when I didn't have my DSLR with me. This camera obviously very vastly outperforms the camera on my phone. I can once again take pictures in low light conditions, I like that I can adjust the shutter speed to as long as 15 seconds, I like the macro feature, I like the fisheye effect, I even like the "toy camera" and "miniature" effects, as 'hokey' as they might be.I paid under $80 for this and I got exactly what I wanted, a camera that performs well but of course is not as good as more expensive cameras. If you want better performance, you're going to have to pay more. But this does everything I want it to and more for the price. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great pics at a great price!
Reviews.Author: izzyiz
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for a previous Canon "Power Shot" whose pics were good, but this one is over the top.  The 16.0 MP gives crisp, clear pictures at a great price. The expanded features plus the ability to shoot at 28mm wide-angle make this a great carry-around camera.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: murgletroid
Reviews.Content: This is a very low end point-and-shoot. For this low price, I would expect a camera with very little functionality. But the camera must be able to take sharp photographs: This camera has either poor quality optics, or is unable to focus accurately.Thinking I'd received a defective camera, I returned the first one I received to Canon because of the "soft-focus" photographs. They sent me a refurbished camera in replacement (more on that later). The refurbished camera has the same problem. My ten year old Fuji Finepix 2.0 MP camera takes better pictures than this camera! Because I stupidly threw out the box when I received the camera, I can't return it to Amazon. It will be my beach camera, or something. This camera is not good enough for photographs that I care about.My second annoyance is with Canon: They replaced a brand new camera with a refurbished one. I could have bought a refurbished camera for $30 less: I feel even more ripped off now, even though their service was very helpful and responsive.If you must buy a Canon PowerShot, my recommendation is to buy one of the slightly higher end versions of the same camera; at least the A2400 IS which is only about ten dollars more. Just don't buy this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shooy
Reviews.Author: drizzle
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a easy to use, grab and go, point and click for my classroom.  This camera is perfect!  It takes good indoor and outdoor photos.  It can catch kids running on the playground without blurring them.  This Canon PowerShot is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: This item does not exist
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Miller
Reviews.Content: Canon does not make an A2300 IS.  I have had considerable difficulty with an order for a Canon A2300 IS per the ad:http://www.amazon.com/Canon-PowerShot-Stabilized-Wide-Angle-Recording/dp/B0075SUHKII have spoken to your costumer representative, Alex, who said the ad would be `taken down' pending investigation once I informed him that is was incorrect.  I have since collaborated this with Canon in writing and forwarded the emails to Amazon, and still the add is in place. Canon PowerShot A2300 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optizal {spelling} Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens with 720p HD Video Recording (Silver) . Canon does not make the A2300 IS with Optical Image Stabilization!  Based on this ad I ordered two (2) and returned both until I realized the problem.  I have gone through a considerable effort to help correct this error, both in time and effort. Amazon is still placing this incorrect ad.  I wonder why.

Reviews.Title: A2300 Very Slim and Light
Reviews.Author: Lucchese
Reviews.Content: It's tiny - only 0.750 inches thick.  Looks even smaller.  Very compact - easily in shirt pocket - hardly noticeable. Rechargeable Lithium-ion battery is fantastic.  Huge upgrade from our old Canon A570 which consumed AA batteries like no tomorrow and always made trouble with its infernal unreliable battery contacts.  The A2300 is reliable - rechargeable battery & contacts are solid - big relief.  BIG $aving$ in batteries-----Weight: 4.4-ouncesDimensions: 0.75 x 3.7 x 2.1 inches-----SD MEMORY Card -__ To use this camera you need to install an SD Memory Card - not included in the box.  Canon probably assumes you're upgrading from another camera and you already have some memory cards lying around.  We had three SD cards for the A570.  In the A2300 am using only 512-MByte card - relatively small compared with 32-GBytes used by some these days.  My theory - smaller memory means longer battery life.  Large SD cards can draw 100-milliamps during data transfer - a fairly large current for a small battery. The 512-MByte card still holds 2,813 Photos in 640x480 (i.e. email attachment format) - or almost 6-minutes of Video, same resolution. A 2-GByte SD Card can hold 9,999 Photos or about 23-minutes of Video - again 640x480-----Optional CARRY CASE - HDE Case for Canon Powershot - Weight: 0.8 ounce -__ Small soft neoprene case to protect the A2300. Great fit. Even with the case it's still a tiny package-----Optional ACCESSORY KIT - Spare Batteries/Rapid Travel Charger/Mini Tripod/Asia&Euro; AC-Plug Adapter/12v-DC Car Adapter/Cleaning Cloth&Fluid;/LCD Screen Protectors/et cetera - 2-Pack NB-11L High-Capacity Lithium-ion Batteries & Rapid Travel Charger - with UltraPro BONUS__ This kit deal is very good. Probably a good price for the two batteries alone. These batteries have 900-mAh capacity. The Canon factory battery is only 680-mAh. The AC-Plug Adapter is very handy - adapts any AC plug from the 2-blade US-standard to the 2-post standard found in many Asian & Euro countries. This AC-Plug Adapter is Universal - can be used with any device you have along

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Robin Raef
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday and i have had it a couple months. i have tried all the different settings and functions. so far my favorite mode of shooting is the miniature mode. I have had a lot of fun using this camera and the different settings. its easy to figure out and easy to carry with you in your pocket or in a case. i will surely be buying canon again.

Reviews.Title: Mislabeled, Canon does not make an A2300 IS
Reviews.Author: DavidM
Reviews.Content: Amazon has made a mistake in listing this product. There is no such thing as an A2300 IS. The IS stands for Image Stabilization. Canon only makes an A2300 which does not have Image Stabilzation. I ordered this product and had to return it because it was not what was described.If you are looking for Image Stabilzation you need to purchase the A2400 IS, the next step up from the A2300. For me personally, it is worth spending a few bucks more for the Image Stabilzation feature. This is a feature you will appreciate, especially when using your zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Juan Corona "Johnny Crown"
Reviews.Content: If You are looking for a pocket camera, with great resolution, easy to use, high quality and good price, this is your option. I gave this to my sister as bday present and she love it. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Power Shot Wow!
Reviews.Author: Harriet McGonigle
Reviews.Content: My pictures of Hawaii are outstanding. The Cannon Powershot is a powerhouse in a tiny package. I bought it for the size and ease of use and was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera all around!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Love the battery pack.  I've noticed that any camera with a battery pack tends to last a lot longer on a charge than those that just take batteries.  The downside of having to recharge a battery pack is pretty obvious though as you can't just change the batteries on the fly if you want to, unless you've planned ahead and bought an extra battery and charged it up ahead of time as well.I suggest a higher quality SD card than the standard.  The pictures save a lot faster, though it's not terrible with a standard SD card either.  SD's are just so cheap though, that you might as well opt for a high speed card and not have to worry about missing out on a second shot during a critical moment where you're trying to capture something that you know is only going to last for seconds.  It's pretty frustrating when you're first shot looks like crap because you shook too much and you didn't get a chance to take a second shot because you're camera is busy saving!  I don't mean to be too harsh though because this camera doesn't take longer than the average to save an image.  It's just a drawback of digital cameras at this price point in general.The quality and clarity of the photos are amazing, except in low light situations.  In these situations it still does a lot better than any other camera at this price point.  If you're overly concerned about this, you're going to have to spend at the very least another $50 to go with a camera with a CMOS sensor.  The best cheap CMOS camera I've seen is the Panasonic Lumix DMC-SZ7 at $130.  I can't hold this Canon's low-light shortcomings against it though because as I said, it does better than anything else at this price point that I've seen.The only genuinely frustrating thing I've experienced so far is that the camera relies pretty heavily on you either knowing what you're doing, or on you pressing the "auto" button before snapping each shot.  The camera takes really nice pictures when the settings are right and it does a good job of selecting the right setting for you if you hit the "auto" button before each picture, but taking a picture on the wrong setting can result in some gruesome photos.Overall I don't know that there's anything better on the market at this price point right now.  Give it a month or two though!

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: I needed a new camera, as I was tired of looking at not so good pics using my iPhone.  I am glad I got it, my previous camera was a Canon, similar class, so I was hoping to have the same quality photos since this was considerably less in price.  The picture quality is very good, better than expected.  Pictures came out great in a dark night club, so I was happy.  Also very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Superman Camera
Reviews.Author: mjacobson
Reviews.Content: My wife has managed to distroy every camera that I have given her.  If she has not dropped it, as she moves about with the camera strapped to her wrist, it gets hit against some furniture.  This camer is virtually indestructable!  And it takes expellent pictures at the same time.  If I knew that it was so good, I would have purchased one for my teenage son and myself.

Reviews.Title: Nice and Small
Reviews.Author: B. Henne
Reviews.Content: received this camera and have used it for a few days. So far its awesome. I would highly recommend this as a portable camera for summer fun

Reviews.Title: My Camera...
Reviews.Author: ToySoldierFan24
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Canon Powershot A2300 IS 16.0 MP,5X Optical zoom 28mm Wide Angle lens Camera. It has a nice sleek design which I like,the pictures I have taken so far have great clarity,beautiful color. The pictures taken make you feel as if "You are there",is the best way I can explain them. I recommend this camera to anyone,as I`m very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marc Jaffrey
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 9 year old daughter.  It is easy to use and takes great pictures and video.  Highly recommend it.  Most importantly she loves it.

Reviews.Title: This is an awful camera.
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money on this! This camera takes blurry photos and the video is horrible. If your looking for a point and shoot, go with the SD1300.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A2300  Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen1st
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on June 27,2013 and have used it 3 times so far.  It's  a nice little camera.  I bought red.  It is a little bit slow between shots but it seems to me I read that there is a "Burst" mode if you want to take faster shots.  I have not checked that out so don't know for sure.  It's stylish and small.  Lightweight and easy to carry around.The only drawback I've found isn't with the camera, it's with the so called Manual.  I had to find it online and download it to find the help I was looking for.  Namely, how to delete all the photo's at the same time.  It would be nice if a real manual was provided or manual on DVD.  Also it doesn't come with an SD card, which I knew before I purchased it.I dropped it on a hard surface already and it wasn't damaged.  Try not to do that though!  ;-)I would purchase this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture clarity
Reviews.Author: nikolas reece
Reviews.Content: Thsi camera takes really excellent photos. Can wait to upload to my computer. the battery life is excellent. I took over 500 pictures over a 5 day holiday and it still has battery life in it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Sheyla Gomes
Reviews.Content: After lots of research I decided that this was the best camera for my boyfriend. And yes it was! This camera takes some awesome and clear photos and even in low-light it does a decent job. He loved the camera and uses it a lot because of the great photo quality and awesome shooting modes. I definitely recommend this camera. Its affordable and great.

Reviews.Title: Camera gift for our daughter
Reviews.Author: Cynthia L. Neuenschwander "Cindy n"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our daughter... who is now a new mother...  Wanted her to be able to take baby pictures.  WOW.... this camera is wonderful!!!  Catches the moment!  Very pleased with this purchase and Amazon is GREAT !!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera / Value
Reviews.Author: Daniel P. Biggs "DB"
Reviews.Content: Very light and easy to travel with this camera.  Super easy to use.  Takes awesome pictures!  Huge improvement vs. prior models for sure.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: GJ
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for my son and couldn't be happier.  He loves it.  Easy to use, easy to charge, easy to download the photos.  Great pictures.You can not go wrong with this camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera for $ spent
Reviews.Author: farmboy
Reviews.Content: Size of Camera is nice for traveling. Takes great pictures. Held up to Kid abuse. Was impressed with the speed at which the camera responded for the quick moments that children offer.Thanks for good service and a good product.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A2300: NOT AS ADVERTISED!!
Reviews.Author: david m henderson
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY!! This camera dose not preform as advertised. Initially I ordered this a2300 from amazon but after ordering I noticed the delivery date was sometime in January Of 2013. I wanted by Christmas of 2012. I tried to cancel the order unsuccessfully. Meanwhile, I ordered one from walmart online which came in one day to my local store. We used the walmart camera but ALL OUR PHOTOS WERE FUZZY! The camera couldn't seem to properly focus on any shot no matter weather indoor or outdoor. We sell on ebay so we use the camera almost every day. The cannon a2300 performance was unacceptable. My wifes old 4 mp camera worked way better than the a2300 with 14 mp. (My iPhone 3G 2mp camera is also better!) At this point we had not yet sent back the Amazon a2300 camera so we decided to give it a shot. The Amazon a2300 worked better than the one we got from walmart, but it had the same problem. The cannon a2300 dose not focus well. Photos are sub standard, no matter what setting you use. I had high hopes for this camera and we honestly tried every setting and light condition including flash but the results were always the same for two a2300's. DO NOT BUY!!

Reviews.Title: Really?
Reviews.Author: laurielou
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera. It was on sale and there were so many positive reviews, and I know Canon is supposed to make good cameras, so I decided to give it a shot.Boy was I disappointed. I'm actually shocked this camera has good reviews at all. Either people have never had a decent point and click camera so they don't know what a good one really is, or I have a dud.You can only change the iso speed in the Program mode. All other pre-programmed modes have auto iso, and sometimes it takes 3 seconds or more for it take the frigging picture. That doesn't work well when your subject is a child. And you can't use the image stabilization in the Program mode. I've been tinkering with it for days now, using every combination of settings I can, and yet my 3 yr old is just a blur because the Digital IS mode doesn't take pictures quickly or clearly enough. I would not recommend this camera for action shots... which excludes most children. Well, it can capture my 3 month old pretty well, but that's mostly because he's not very mobile, but he will be and then he, too, will be just a blur.) Also, the image size in Digital IS mode is pre-set and you can't change it, so the pics are only 1600x1200 or thereabouts.The macro function is decent, though not as sharp as I'm used to. I frequently take pictures of my handmade products to sell online, so the macro is a must for detail shots. This camera would be decent enough for this purpose to get by. But there are much better ones available that also take action shots.The only way I've been able to take "good" pictures with this camera is with the option of programming all the settings myself, and even then they weren't anything special and not nearly sharp enough to be considered quality. All other options are sub-par and quite frankly, useless. (And really, fisheye? Does anyone actually use that?) Even the auto function comes out fuzzy, even in still pictures.The only plus about this camera is the one-push video recording. The videos themselves aren't the greatest, but they'd do.It may fit other people's needs, but not mine. It will be returned and I'll probably get another Lumix, because I know they work well.Update - I've gone through the pictures I've taken with this camera, and you can reduce the fuzziness of the pictures if you shrink them - I took mine down to 2000x1500 - but even then they still look a little "soft". So if you don't care about having quality large pictures, then I'm sure it will be fine. Though it's still not good for action shots.

Reviews.Title: No Optical Image Stabilization!
Reviews.Author: C. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: This camera does not, in fact, have optical IS.  This can be confusing, because even the Canon website mentions this for some reason, but it is truly only digital IS.  Steve's Digicams, Engadget, Reviews.cnet, as well as the initial press release, inform us of this.  To get optical IS you need to get the A2400 IS.

Reviews.Title: No internal memory at all
Reviews.Author: karl
Reviews.Content: I have never bought a camera that had ZERO internal memory.  Had to go out and buy a card before I could even take one picture.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, so-so picture quality
Reviews.Author: Chazz
Reviews.Content: This 16 MP A2300 produced no better pictures than my old 2 MP Kodak CX4230, so the Canon went back to Amazon. Evidently the higher sensor resolution is offset by an inferior lens. I took pictures of the same subjects taken both indoors with flash and outdoors in good natural light and compared them blown up on a high resolution monitor in Paint.net, Paint Shop Pro, and Irfanview. The Canon software for viewing and managing pictures requires a download of Microsoft Silverlight if that program is not already on your computer. Recognizing that this is an inexpensive point and shoot camera, I nevertheless did expect it to produce substantially better quality photos than my old tech camera or even my cell phone. Physically it is a nice little package that seems to be well made.

Reviews.Title: Small but efficient
Reviews.Author: Sarah Haynes
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this, and because her disability leaves her struggling with her right hand, it has become a great therapy tool to exercise both hands at once.

Reviews.Title: A Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Adriana
Reviews.Content: We try it yesterday and it worked out perfectly! Good photos for low price, we're really pleased with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ria S
Reviews.Content: The little baby is awesome!! ...... Takes great pics. However you should travel with your charger if you are going to be doing videos, after a while the battery will die down. Overall, great camera ^_^

Reviews.Title: Memory card not included
Reviews.Author: Richard Lothian "Hood Rich III"
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe that the memory card you need to operate the camera does not come with it. Why don't they just charge ten bucks more and include it?

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Olivia
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics. Comes with a battery and charger. A USB to immport the pics. Great value and a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great photos!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Workers
Reviews.Content: I use this camera at work to take quick photos in situations where I don't always have time to make adjustments, or to get perfectly still. I love this camera for its simplicity of use, and its wonderfully clear photographs.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A. Luisotti "cyndelu"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to the small size. This camera works extremely well and fits into a regular sized pocket. I bought it for a wonerful sale price. The wide angle lens works like a charm. This lives up to it's company name.

Reviews.Title: Bought specifically for hackability - intervalometer, HDR bracketing, and RAW capable!
Reviews.Author: Kilgore Gagarin "Those who believe in telekin...
Reviews.Content: You have to modify your Canon A2300 in order to avail yourselves of features like intervalometer, HDR bracketing, and capturing pictures in the RAW format. This camera CAN be so modified.I discovered that many Canon PowerShot cameras, including this one, can have their capabilities extended by using free software called CHDK (Canon Hack Development Kit). I received my PowerShot A2300 yesterday and in one day have been able to install and successfully use CHDK on this machine. The native A2300 firmware doesn't include an "intervalometer" feature (the ability to have the camera continually shoot pictures every n seconds over a given amount of time, something useful for astronomical movement). I've verified that an included intervalometer script with CHDK does exactly what I want. I can also now specify that the pictures are stored in RAW format and not compressed automatically to jpeg. Finally, you can set this up for bracketing, or taking a series of pictures with automatically changed ISO, shutter speed, and aperture.A very sturdy and nice point and shoot from Canon has just become one of my best buys ever. Next stop? Kite Aerial Photography using this small camera and its new features.Bravo Canon! Bravo CHDK team!UPDATE 12 JULY 2013: There is at least one book available on Amazon specifically about CHDK: The Canon Camera Hackers Manual: Teach Your Camera New Tricks (I have not purchased or read it).

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot (it)
Reviews.Author: Bob MacLeod
Reviews.Content: I have owned five digital cameras, my most recent two--stil in use--are Canon PowerShots. Those two alone have more than 16,000 photos taken. So I have a lot of experience with Canon's small cameras, and this was to be my kid's first camera.A Point-and-Shoot should be able to do just that. I received it and immediately took it to Africa on a business trip, thinking it would be a great way to test it before giving it to my son. I regretted not bringing my own SD850, because I did not get a single good picture (out of 160 taken), never mind a "great" photo. No matter how many settings I tweaked--settings that were hard to find as they are layed deep in menus--the results were dismal.And worse--and this is critically important--if you hand your camera to a stranger to take your photo for you, they should be able to just press the button. With this camera, the stranger-taken photos were so bad they immediately went in the trash--every one of them.Immediately upon my return to the US, I returned this camera.Also, as an aside, Canon has a fatal flaw with their cameras: All cameras use the same hard-coded numbering system. So if I have three cameras, I am forced to rename every photo, or I will end up with the same filename--but different pictures. I don't mind renaming--and I do it anyway, but when my wife's and my camera reached the same number sequence in the same month, I could not even download them into the same month's folder. Very frustrating. But this is true of ALL Canon cameras, not just this model.

Reviews.Title: Expected a lot more especially by all the positive reviews
Reviews.Author: plumber
Reviews.Content: I have a nice canon 1080p camcorder that takes nice pictures but I wanted something smaller for my wife for her to carry. The quality of these photos is great if you are outside sunshine or indoors with LOTS of light. Other than that, its bad.Very poor and grainy quality in darker environments (think fine dining restaurant lighting). Its terrible. Action shots, forget it the camera isn't fast enough to even capture my dogs romping in the yard.The menu options are very limited, which is typical of a point and shoot. The buttons are very small and sometimes going back and forth between pictures is hard. I'm ordering a different canon model because I believe there is something better...

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: David L. Hlavac "Dave H"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a bulkier Canon Power Shot A540. The smaller A2300 IS takes beautiful, crisp pictures and is much more convenient to carry and use. Neither my wife nor I have "smart phones" so we still rely on a separate camera device for our photos. Price was right, and I would recommend this for anyone still using a camera instead of a phone for family pictures.

Reviews.Title: Camera spec's
Reviews.Author: Arnold P Bohringer
Reviews.Content: False advertising: Camera was a A2300,not an A2300 IS.I though I was purchasing a camera with optical image stabilization.This camera has digital image stabilization.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Nisha Starsmith
Reviews.Content: I read peoples reviews and almost didn't get it but I'm happy I did ...... the battery never dies so try it out for your self

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Sunilkumar Halcheri
Reviews.Content: This Camera is worth buying if your budget is less than 100$, and using it only for taking photographs o your kids or neighbourhood. Very handy.... Bought 2 of them...

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: macdonaldartist
Reviews.Content: I needed an affordable point-and-shoot camera with many megapixels as I often crop my photos quite a bit.  The clarity of the images remains great even when I crop off a large portion of the original.  I like the compact size and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Nice inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Canon always delivers cameras that take great pictures without having to set them up. This camera could have a better screen and faster refresh times, but for the low end price it is superlative. This is a glove compartment camera that takes very good pictures that can be blown up. The digital zoom works well, but again, for a cheap camera. If you want better you'll have to go up a notch to the $200 range.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: MamaRox
Reviews.Content: This is a good little camera,the picture quality is great..... but it is definitely not red.  It's PINK!!  I still would recommend it

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera. Great price. First digital camera. Has all that I really need and more. Used for ebay pictures and family pictures. Great quality shots. Pretty easy to use. Very happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: good gift
Reviews.Author: sandra gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. My partner got me one just like it a few years ago. I got this one for a gift. This one was updated since I got mine. I gave it to my parents so that they can have a small, and easy to use camera for their trip abroad.This camera is small, light, and very user friendly. I had to get something simple but with quality for my parents (not very good with technology). The picture quality is good, charging is easy, not too many buttons. Very happy with the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point and Shoot for my Tween
Reviews.Author: dealgirl
Reviews.Content: We wanted a "real" camera with some features without breaking the bank for our tween. This was ideal. Super cute due to bright blue color, good photos, and very affordable. Our whole family owns Canons and we love 'em.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly OBrien
Reviews.Content: Canon makes the best cameras around. Bought this to be able to take pictures at dog shows, and not have to always lug around our digital slr.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: beth
Reviews.Content: This camera is stellar. I am going to France, and I needed something better than my 5.0 mp blackberry for photos. I realized that if I was purchasing a camera less than $100 I couldn't have too many expectations (unlike some other reviewers on here). The battery needs to be charged before it is inserted into the camera. You will need to purchase an SD card of whatever size you like (I had one already); these cost about $10 depending on the memory size. I put the charged battery and the SD card in the camera, and I was taking crystal clear pictures within minutes.  I read the quick start guide after I had taken some photos, just to clarify how to review pictures I had taken. I plugged the camera into my Macbook Air using the cord provided. I did not install any software, although the camera came with a CD. My computer immediately recognized the camera and asked if I wanted to download the photos. I did.  It then asked if I would like to share a photo. I did. I shared to Facebook. Voilà (that's French -- see the tie-in?).This is exactly what I needed for my trip.  And it is tiny! Great for whipping out to photograph a building facade, and then back into my little chic Paris purse.Fin (that's "the end" in French).

Reviews.Title: Great camara
Reviews.Author: Robo
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday and i have had it a couple months. i have tried all the different settings and functions. so far my favorite mode of shooting is the miniature mode. I have had a lot of fun using this camera and the different settings. its easy to figure out and easy to carry with you in your pocket or in a case. i will surely be buying canon again.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Eutsler "The 'A' Stands for Awesome"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much! The quality of the pictures and video are fantastic and all the different features and photo filters are great. This is my first well known brand digital camera and I am so glad I decided to grab this up when it was on sale(I got it for $73 here on Amazon in Feb.). Easily one of the best things I've purchased so far this year! Love it. :)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Grove
Reviews.Content: I realize that most people will use their phones for quick snapshots but this is a really good movie and image grabber.

Reviews.Title: Daughter's Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Irene Santana
Reviews.Content: She loves it. The pictures come out great. The color is just slightly darker but in my daughters opinion "OMG, this is such a cool color". Slender enough where she can slip it in her back pocket. You can't go wrong with a Canon.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera!
Reviews.Author: Doug DePew "Military Memoirs"
Reviews.Content: This is only the second digital camera I've owned. The first one was a nice camera for a simple point and shoot, but it broke. I had it in my back pocket in a honky tonk and leaned against a rail. The lens never worked right again. I bought this one because Canon is a name I trust. I have not been disappointed.This camera has been flawless and takes extremely high quality images. The zoom is quite good for a relatively inexpensive point and shoot camera. The automatic settings cover just about any situation I've been in, but it does have easy to use custom settings. It seems durable, also. It's a great camera!I simply love this camera. I just won't carry it in my back pocket.

Reviews.Title: Birthday Gift
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R. Lorine "Energy Angel"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my 7 year old son.  He wants to start taking pictures and videos.  For the price the durability of this camera and quality can not be beat!  The camera is very user friendly making it easy for a child or adult to navigate through.  Very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Terrific Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy S. Schmitt "retired"
Reviews.Content: It arrived before I expected it.  Everything  included except SD card and camera case, which I had also ordered and received.  It comes with a USB to transfer pictures to computer.  Also very good instructions, including a CD.  I have not taken pictures yet but know the quality because of a friend who sent pictures to me from the same camera.  I always read Amazon's reviews before purchasing anything.  I am thrilled with the products Amazon sells, except for bird seed and plant soil.  Those sellers charge too much postage for my pocketbook.

Reviews.Title: Light and Powerful
Reviews.Author: K. Kalteissen "Proud Grandma"
Reviews.Content: I love this small, light Canon camera.  It will be just the thing to take on vacation instead of the old, heavy camera I used to take.

Reviews.Title: turns on fast.
Reviews.Author: eikm
Reviews.Content: a lamp will throw off the flash sensor. if your closer than 2ft the camera will try to auto focus too much. 17" is what is advertised and a bit off for the auto feature. flash is bright and its small. would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: Great for price
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small, cheap camera that I can use to capture some quick photos and this little thing did the trick. I wish that the autoflash worked better, but I guess there's no light sensor on the camera so it can't really detect how much light is in the room. I don't really mind turning on or off flash as needed though. For the price it works great. Photos are sharp (definitely better than the photos my Lg Optimus G took) and its easy to use and figure out all the functions. Recommended for those who just want a small nifty camera they can bring around and capture a quick moment with.

Reviews.Title: Great novice camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Jodie
Reviews.Content: I've only dallied briefly with a pretty decrepit Panasonic I bought in 2008, so I rarely take pictures. But this was a great novice camera for spring break. It wasn't brilliant at adapting to different light even in auto mode,  but some minor retouching cleared it up. I don't think I'd recommend it for real camera connoisseurs but for me and my friends to take on Spring Break it was brilliant. A small point and shoot that was affordable enough to not be paranoid about all holiday.Unlike other reviewers I didn't have a problem with blurry pictures and to point and shoot it worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: Small, easy to operate, good buy.
Reviews.Author: J. R. Trantham "JTRAT"
Reviews.Content: This camera is small enough to fit in your shirt pocket and is easy to operate. It comes with charger and all connectors to easily download photos or movies to computer for editing and printing.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Rosi
Reviews.Content: It was for a gift and the person is super happy with the quality of the pictures she get with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: happy
Reviews.Content: A great camera. It is very handy to take along where ever I go.  the pictures I have taken with it are great.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: P. Behr
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my elderly mother and she had no problem figuring out how to use it. It takes great family pics....exactly what she wanted. :)

Reviews.Title: great camara
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Chavarría
Reviews.Content: Very cool camara...I haven t had trouble with it, Nice resolution, and it s very easy to use,good choice.

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: Rafael Eduardo Acevedo Infante
Reviews.Content: e x c e l e n t e  p r o d u c t o  r e c o m e n d a d o

Reviews.Title: Camera software problem
Reviews.Author: David L. Souder
Reviews.Content: Camera software would not work with my computer despite best efforts of Canon support representatives.  Running Windows XP SP3, which should have been OK, but we couldn't make it happen.  Returned camera to Amazon (and was surprised how easy that process was).

Reviews.Title: Slow
Reviews.Author: E. Davis
Reviews.Content: Very slow can not take moving pictures at all . It's ok for for  just random still pics.... Good for price

Reviews.Title: I was expecting more
Reviews.Author: Mother of boys
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 11 year old son for Christmas. I have a canon powershot elph sd750 that I love! I thought this camera may just be a small step down and considering mine is 6 years old I thought the technology would've better for the price. The wait time in between pictures even in great light is about 5 seconds and there are very few features. The zoom is great and it is light weight.

Reviews.Title: Good basic camera
Reviews.Author: Kaliki Chaitanya Reddy "chaits_r"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Light weight, easy to use, big LCD screen. Decent image quality in good lightCons:The mechanism to keep the battery secure is quite flimsy amid could potentially break. The performance in low light is not the greatest.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Brenda J. Mollner "Shortcuthappy"
Reviews.Content: Like the color; true to picture.  Easy set up; Easy to use.  Sometimes the pre-set box confuses me, however the picture turns out just as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Four Fingers
Reviews.Content: still catches blur in some action shots but otherwise outstanding for the price I paid. Canon is always the way to go for affordable quality.

Reviews.Title: Usual Canon reliability
Reviews.Author: Dawnimac "Dawnimac"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon Sureshot as I was upgrading my older model.  Disappointed that there is nooptical viewfinder, but I should have noticed this on the description.The menu is more difficult to access than my previous models, so only now 3 months later, have I foundhow to make the resolution smaller for e-mailing. As I mostly use the photos for e-mail, I am now wonderingif there was any point in changing to a 16 megapixel camera! However I am quite satisfied with the  new one.I miss having a  full instruction booklet as before.

Reviews.Title: The camera is not working
Reviews.Author: Olston THorman
Reviews.Content: The Item is not working. the battery is charging fully outside of the camera but when placed in the camera the camera is reporting the battery as not charged. hence the camera is not working

Reviews.Title: Works Temporarily.
Reviews.Author: Blue Team
Reviews.Content: Well, as I had just recently written a positive review, the camera is shot. After less than 8 months and probably a grand total of 50 photos, the shutter is jammed. Everything seems to work otherwise, but it does not perform its most basic function that it should. All photos are a solid black. The camera has never been dropped, is physically flawless, and was always kept in a protective case. Loss of trust in Canon with this toy.

Reviews.Title: FUZZY Photos!!!
Reviews.Author: Hiromi H.
Reviews.Content: Luckily I purchased this camera with a bit of extra time to test it out before my trip. I love Canon cameras so I'm super disappointed about the extremely fuzzy photo quality. It's so unbearable that this camera will be my very first ever Amazon return. Some might consider this camera if it had decent bells and whistles despite the photo quality but there is no added incentive here. If this is what you get for what you pay for, then I guess I'm willing to pay a bit more. However, it's the perfect size for my upcoming backpacking trip, so that's a plus.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: MrsMendlebright
Reviews.Content: This little camera is sooo nice! I love the rechargeable batt pack, the sd card, the ease of use, and what could be better than a bright pink camera?! It takes great pics, and has so many settings it's unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: Okay camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: This camera looks great, and does what you need it to do.However, it is definitely a casual user camera and not to be compared with anything professional. I find you have to be too still to get good shots, and that it takes a bit long to shoot. It seems to load for like a second before a shot is taken.The quality is good, but not as great as I would expect.It is okay, and good for the price, but I think I would search for one that shoots faster. Probably a good camera if you're on a budget, but might be worth to spend a little more for a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Lens went bad after 3 months
Reviews.Author: Atiba Wiltshire
Reviews.Content: We got this camera in  October and it took some really good pics but the lens stopped expanding and retracting after just 3 months. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Jeffinner07
Reviews.Content: Great and easy to carry. charges fast and easy to manage (for my mom which is not a tech pro). I love the color and resolution of the pictures. The pictures come out amazing, almost professional!

Reviews.Title: Unexpectedly good camera with quick set up
Reviews.Author: D. Vera "readyreader"
Reviews.Content: Wow!  great small camera!  It fits in shirt pocket and takes great pics and sets up fast.  Super Value too!

Reviews.Title: Great value with lots of unexpected neat features
Reviews.Author: David N. Hollas
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use point and shoot.  I use it for wildlife, parties, house construction, and other random events and it performs very well.  It has a great auto focus feature that recognizes faces and the object of the photo.  This works flawlessly 95% of the time, which is quite high for this price range.  The battery lasts an exceptionally long time.  I am fairly diligent about recharging, but used to run my batteries out with Kodak cameras - that has yet to happen with this camera.  Plugging it into the computer, it reads the pics right away for easy transfer.One more bonus, the video function has exceptionally good resolution and sound.  I was shocked that you can even hear my breaths while holding it and recording videos - it's that good.  Highly recommend for the average picture taker.  Ernest photographers will of course need a tier or two above this.

Reviews.Title: Needed a new camera
Reviews.Author: Sandy Wood
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a replacement for an older Canon digital that finally gave up the ghost. I like it because the buttons and commands are mostly the same, a lot less to relearn. I like that you can view your pictures without powering the thing on. Nice touch. I went on vacation and forgot to bring the battery charger. The rechargeable battery was good for about 150 pictures and then towards the end of the trip it died on me. I would have loved to have a 'bracketing' feature in this model but it appears that you need to step up to a more expensive model for that feature.

Reviews.Title: For the Price, It is what I needed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "TCertain"
Reviews.Content: I have an expensive camera, but its not something you want to carry around all the time. This takes good photos, is light-weight and you can pick up those quick shots that you wished you had your camera for.

Reviews.Title: Picture is misleading
Reviews.Author: noodleman
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that took good pictures> While this may take good pictures, it has no viewfinder which makes it hard to focus when it is a sunny day.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Snapshot Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: John R. Rambo
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my opinion is a bit biased as I got it as an Amazon Deal of the Day, so it was only $59. I think ordinarily it sells for around $90. I would probably been a little more reticent to buy at that price point.The battery lasts a long time...but when it is kaput, it is kaput all of a sudden. The Battery Display on the LCD screen shows Full, then all of a sudden it tells you the battery is exhausted. This causes me to consider purchasing a 2nd battery, so as to not be out shooting & have my plans cut short by an unexpected dead battery. I will probably search Amazon or eBay for that: typically, buying a replacement battery from the manufacturer is expensive.The PowerShot A2300 takes great snapshots.The LCD Display is adequate; you can turn off all of the displayed info and just concentrate on the subject if you choose.I just took a shot yesterday of an old rooftop neon sign, on a 10 story building, blocks away. I had it at full zoom, 20x, and the Auto-Focus got me a shot that was very clear & sharp. No blur. I was impressed.The included PC software (presumably Mac, too, but you better check...) is unimpressive. Not that I had difficulties with it or anything. It just doesn't do anything that my preexisting image software does not already accomplish. I suspect that had I owned no image manipulation software already, and had only to rely upon the included Canon software, I would be looking for something better (ie. Photoshop, PaintShop Pro or Gimp) rather quickly.I wish the camera's onboard software did a little more, such as offer me the ability to take black & white shots, sepia tone, filtering. The kind of thing offered on the cameras on smartphones. I like using that stuff. The absence of that filtering stuff is the reason I gave only 4 stars. You might say, "The photos look great, which is what it is supposed to do. Why judge it for what it lacks in filtering abilities?" My answer to that is, "If the onboard digital filtering is available on my cheap Samsung Android phone, or even the older LG slide-out-keyboard phone (only 1 Mpx!) I had before it, then it would have been simple for Canon to have offered similar functionality built into this PowerShot. They did not." Thus, 4 stars.This camera, however, does take 5-star, 16 mega-pixel, color snapshots.If you can get this camera for under $65, snap it up immediately. If it is priced higher, maybe shop around, comparison shop, etc..

Reviews.Title: Pocket size, Easily carried
Reviews.Author: Nelda Klawetter "nnk"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use but not for large hands. Great for youth & small ladies hands. Easier to learn the features than some . Love the color but it needs a case to protect it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera, I Love It! Just Don't Forget To Smile ;)
Reviews.Author: Arthur Senior "Small Engine Mechanic"
Reviews.Content: I have used cheap digital camera's in the past and none of them were any good. I am an amateur photographer and I enjoy taking snapshots of all kinds of things, especially nature. I bought this hoping I would finally have a quality camera at my disposal, that would allow me to take amazing pictures. However, I didn't have enough money to afford those expensive DSLR cameras, so this was going to have to do.Unlike cheap cameras that wont focus, or don't even have macro, this one can. Its pretty much an all around point and shoot camera, and while it allows you to set manual options for the scene, using the auto mode you don't have to. The power button is on the top, press it once, it comes on, and your ready to take pictures right away. You have to hold the shutter button down half way for a few seconds for the camera to auto focus and to adjust lighting, then press it down all the way to take the shot.I like the fact that this camera has a flash, and its so smart that it knows just how much light to give at any given time. Most of the time the flash will go off when indoors or when there is no light, such as night time. But I took some pics inside where all I had was one window open bringing in light, and the camera chose not to use the flash, its so smart. You can also manually adjust the shutter speed of the camera, but I prefer to keep it all on auto, as that takes away a lot of the guess work for beginners.The camera has a macro mode function as well, this allows you to get super close to an object and get it in focus instead of a blurry picture. The largest use I have for macro is taking close ups of flowers, but can be used for electronic buffs who want to take pics of circuit boards, or for the cute types who take close up pics of their animals faces. I wanted to take a few pics of myself but I had no one to hold the camera. And while I can take pics of my own face by holding the camera out, its so limited to what you can do.This camera also has a timer function, you can use a preset 2 second, or 10 second delay. And if you need more time then that, you can set a custom timer function such as 20 seconds or 30 seconds. I was able to go a distance away from the camera and make a pose and the timer function worked flawlessly. I was very happy with the shots I got. You can also set the timer function to take multiple shots as well, not just one.This camera also has a zoom function, it has a 5x optical zoom and has 15x digital. In most cases 5x zoom is all that you will need, I was able to take beautiful shots from a distance using the optical zoom. Sometimes though if your taking pics of a bird far away, or a mountain that is a distance away, you can add a little digital zoom to. Keep in mind though, digital zoom does degrade picture quality so only use it if you have to.I noticed something important about this camera, I feel the need to mention. Its a 16MP camera. However, if you don't have enough light on the subject, it seems to take 9MP shots. For example, indoor shots might end up being 9MP, where as outside in full sunlight, you will get the full 16MP. The camera automatically chooses the size of the pic based on the amount of light you have so make sure you have a lot if you want 16MP.This camera also has the ability to take video, 720P HD to be specific. Unlike taking pictures where you have the flash for low light, the flash can not be used while taking video. This means you need a lot of light, otherwise your video will turn out grainy. I find shooting outdoors best and the quality of video is on par with my 720P Creative Vado pocket cam. Its not 1080P though, but I didn't get it for taking video.When you put the camera in play mode, you can be able to display the pics or video you took and navigate them by using the left and right buttons, and using the middle button to select them. You can also zoom in on the pics you took using the zoom wheel and you can also delete the pics or video you took from the camera as well. When your ready to upload them, just plug the camera into an available USB port using the included cable, the computer detects your camera and you can download the pics right away.The camera unfortunately does not come with an SD card, which is needed for taking a lot of pics or video. I bought a 16GB SD card and I have never filled it up yet. But to give you an idea on battery life, I was able to take 250 pics, without flash, before the lithium battery died, and it only took a few hours to charge it back up with the included charger. If you were to use flash for every picture, I would say you could take half that many.I've used digital cameras long enough to know about how quickly you can drain batteries. So I bought 2 more battery packs with a second charger, so I would always have a fresh battery at the ready. I also bought a protective case for the camera as well as a mini tripod for small stuff. On the bottom of the camera is a compartment door that you slide out to the right side of the unit, which opens to reveal the battery and SD card. So its pretty easy to change out.One of the things that I think is cool is how when you turn the camera on, the lens pops out, and then when you turn the camera off, the lens retracts in and a shutter covers the lens to protect it against scratches or dirt, very nice Canon! The camera is also small, fits in the palm of your hand, and can fit into a standard dress shirt pocket. I have uploaded some pics that I have taken with this camera. I am very happy with it and I highly recommend it! 5-STARS

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: BASIC CAMERA, WOULD PROBABLY BE GOOD FOR A FIRST TIME USER, WILL LET MY KIDS USE, OK FOR PRICE, CUTE COLOR

Reviews.Title: great pictures but takes time to process..
Reviews.Author: R.S
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice, its small and light also the battery last longer than expected. I do not have any complaints except that it takes some time for the camera to process each shot so if you are trying to take a bunch of shots , this can seem like forever and it will be very very annoying...

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Deborah Rountree
Reviews.Content: The recovery time between shots is hideously slow.  Picture quality is mediocre.  Overall, it's not that great of a camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: chris2059
Reviews.Content: Got for my daughter for her 9th birthday. She loves it, easy to use, shoots good video, takes good pictures, and the battery life is decent before you need to recharge.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Rosie
Reviews.Content: Good camera for day time pictures. Easy to use. The only slight problem is it doesn't take the best night time pictures. I have to hold the camera VERY STILL to take good pictures otherwise it turns out blurry.

Reviews.Title: good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Libby
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted a new small, point and shoot and I didn't want to spend a ton of money since I already own two digital cameras. This camera is very small and light weight. It is easy to use and the price was perfect for the product. Some downfalls? I feel like it takes a few seconds longer to shoot than my previous point and shoots. I also wish there were a few more functions and options.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: LeeAnn Wood
Reviews.Content: Simple to use. Quality photos. Not too expensive. Scandisk card not included, but not costly to get one. Just don't drop it.

Reviews.Title: mild disappointment
Reviews.Author: Howie Beutler-Cruise "LoveToRead"
Reviews.Content: My disappointment is in the fact that no instructions come in booklet.  They are available on line but I find this inconvenient as I do not carry my lap top with me on my camera excursions.  And no, i have not used my printer and ink to make a copy of the PDF!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Louise Paulin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my niece as a birthday gift. I was amazed how small it was and how great the pictures were.  I find my hands get in the way when I take pictures.  I'm used to an SLR camera so I'm not a good judge if this will be a problem for others.  The picture quality was great, they can be blown up without loss of quality.  Photos are easy to download. The battery charged fairly quickly.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Sandra Peterson
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera... Small but takes great pics and videos. Another great cannon product! Fits perfect in diaper bag and purse.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: V. DeWitt
Reviews.Content: My daughter was thrilled with her reddish pink camera (color ordered was red, I was happy to see it was notably pink).  She's having a lot of fun creating her own memories & the picture quality is nice.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Nanci F
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 22 year old daughter.  She absolutely loves it, we were (are) both might pleased.  The best part was that her favorite color is pink, the color choice was red, but when she opened it on her birthday; it was delightfully a hot pink!  Takes great pictures.  Only I think that the memory card should have been included so she didn't have to purchase an additional item to make her camera complete.

Reviews.Title: It's PINK, not red, as described on the site.
Reviews.Author: Troy Riley
Reviews.Content: The camera operates well enough, but I bought this as a birthday present for my 8 year old grandson.  Colors offered were black, grey, and red.  I thought red would stand less chance of being lost.  Imagine my embarrassment when my grandson excitedly opened the box and was confronted with a bright pink camera.  I trusted the verbal description rather than what might have been not a good color image.  I shouldn't have.  Lesson - be careful of color descriptions - they can be very misleading.

Reviews.Title: POS
Reviews.Author: Ramblin' Ron Wiggle
Reviews.Content: This camera is a POS. After one week the lens started sticking on opening and retraction. I sent it back to Canon Warranty. A couple of weeks later I received back a refurbished unit! Well ok, the lens seemed to work ok for a few months, then the refurbished unit started sticking.Contrary to Amazon's advertising this camera does NOT have Image Stabilization (IS). Many of the my low-light photos were blurry and unusable.My impression is that Canon uses recycled coke bottle bottoms for the lenses.I have had many Canon digitals but they just lost my business with this one. I'm going with another brand.

Reviews.Title: On the go beauty!
Reviews.Author: amazdnu
Reviews.Content: I have my big Canon that I just don't wanna drag around with me all the time, I bought this camera just to throw in my purse and go... It's small, lightweight and takes amazing pictures for a small camera.  I take it everywhere with me, to the park, lake ect and don't worry about damaging it.  Very inexpensive for what it is but well worth it!  I love the Canon so much more because it has it's own battery and it lasts 1000 times longer then the camera's with the double A batteries, this battery lasts me a whole few days using it almost all day.  I haven't bought a 2nd battery yet and really don't see a reason to have one.  The Canon rechargeable batteries sure do hold up and I am very impressed!  It's a gotta have camera for the kids, for the enthusiast, for anyone really, like I said, the price is great, the camera takes very impressive pictures and it's so much more lighter weight than my $1200.00 I usually took everywhere with me and it takes pictures that come out as good as my big camera!

Reviews.Title: Good Beginner's Camera, But I Wouldn't Rely on It for Major Life Moments
Reviews.Author: J. Weaver
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as a gift for my daughter's 7th birthday because she's not getting a cell phone any time soon, cameras designed for kids don't take very good pictures, and we just couldn't see letting her handle the DSLR on a regular basis. As a starter camera, this was great. It has very few settings and is quite easy to figure out. My daughter was able to take some really good pictures on a recent family vacation.The camera isn't great, though. While my daughter's pictures (of landscapes, of monuments, of people posing, of herself) were generally clear and focused, I found that when I used the camera to try to capture her and her 2-year-old brother, I often got blurred images or a longer than desired delay between pictures. The camera doesn't allow for a lot of movement by your subjects. And, though you can set it to take several continuous shots and change shooting modes, I generally don't have time to do that when we're in the moment. I just want to be able to grab and shoot. For this, I still prefer my DSLR (which is so old it has a much lower megapixel count, but of such superior quality that it still takes better pictures).Another slight drawback to this camera is that it does not have a viewfinder through which to frame your picture, so you're entirely dependent on the LCD screen which is difficult to see in some lighting (and most especially on gorgeous, sunny days!). I know this is what a lot of people are used to with their digital cameras and phones these days, but I still like to be able to frame my photos the old fashioned way while I'm shooting.One other thing I should mention is battery life. This camera comes with a proprietary battery and charger for said battery. You can't simply replace it with double or triple As. I found the battery life to be relatively short if you're on vacation. We found that on a single day of sight-seeing, we could wear the fully charged battery down completely if we weren't conservative in our use. As there is a slightly slow startup with the camera, this meant that we lost a few good pictures to battery conservation. On a day-to-day basis, however, the battery life is no issue at all (and charging is pretty darn quick).As I said, we looked at this as a beginner camera for a young child. The faults I found with the camera were things with which she had absolutely no issue. So I'd still recommend this camera for someone new to digital photography. It's simple and functional and is going to be ready to go as soon as you. If I could give it 3 1/2 stars, I would.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Hamid Manteghi
Reviews.Content: This camera Takes good quality pictures.  However, not very suited for taking video from a long distance. Over all very practical and reliable.

Reviews.Title: GLOWING ENDORSEMENT
Reviews.Author: RHY Manoa "RHY -  Manoa"
Reviews.Content: As a 50 year Nikon photographer, I tried to stick to Nikon products but have been frustrated with the problems it has with its Point and Shoot cameras.  Starting with the 5400 and 570 models, I have had nothing but really irritating problems with batteries and the dreaded black screen of death.  I was looking for a nice and easy point and shoot replacement that I could use, but my wife could use in a pinch.When the Amazon Lightning Deal for this camera came up at $59.00, I said that I could risk that amount since I blow that much on rechargeable batteries for my other cameras all the time.  When the camera came I put in a Sony SDHC card and started shooting random stuff around the house.  I was very impressed with both the flash and non-flash photos.  My wife took a look at it and said that she was going to use it on her next trip coming up in August.
